name: Baked Rasgulla
description: Soft rasgullas baked for a caramelized twist.
longDescription: A modern variation of the traditional rasgulla, these baked rasgullas are lightly caramelized to create a chewy and sweet delicacy while maintaining their juicy core.
instructions: Store in a cool, dry place. Best consumed within 2 days.
expertTips: Warm slightly before serving for enhanced flavor.
shippingDetails: Delivered in airtight packaging to retain freshness.

name: Barley Malpua
description: A healthy twist on the festive malpua made with barley flour.
longDescription: Barley malpua combines the goodness of barley flour with traditional jaggery syrup, offering a nutritious yet indulgent festive sweet.
expertTips: Top with rabri for a rich dessert experience.
shippingDetails: Delivered in food-grade boxes with cooling packs.

name: Chhena Gaja
description: Odia delight made from chhena, deep-fried and soaked in syrup.
longDescription: Chhena gaja is a popular sweet from Odisha, prepared with fresh chhena and fried until golden brown before being soaked in sugar syrup.
instructions: Consume within 48 hours for best taste.
expertTips: Serve warm with a drizzle of honey.

name: Chhena Poda
longDescription: Chhena poda, literally meaning roasted cheese, is a caramelized baked dessert prepared with fresh chhena, semolina, and sugar, giving it a rich and smoky flavor.
instructions: Keep refrigerated and consume within 3 days.
expertTips: Pair with masala chai for an authentic experience.

name: Khaja Delight
description: Layered crispy sweet soaked in sugar syrup.
longDescription: Khaja is a layered and flaky sweet from Odisha and Bihar, deep-fried until crisp and soaked in fragrant sugar syrup.
expertTips: Pair with tea or coffee as a crunchy snack.

name: Cream Sandesh
description: Bengali sandesh infused with rich cream.
longDescription: A fusion sweet where the classic sandesh is filled with whipped cream, making it light, airy, and indulgent.
expertTips: Garnish with rose petals before serving.

name: Misti Doi
longDescription: Misti doi is a thick, creamy, and sweet yogurt prepared by caramelizing sugar and fermenting milk. A must-have Bengali delicacy.
expertTips: Serve chilled with a garnish of saffron.
shippingDetails: Delivered in clay pots for authentic flavor.

name: Almond Misti Doi
description: Sweet yogurt topped with roasted almonds.
longDescription: A variation of misti doi with crunchy almond pieces, offering a delightful nutty flavor with every spoonful.
instructions: Store in refrigerator. Best before 2 days.
expertTips: Add honey drizzle for extra flavor.

name: Classic Rasgulla
longDescription: The most iconic Bengali sweet, rasgullas are soft, spongy, and soaked in sugar syrup, loved across India.
instructions: Store in syrup and refrigerate. Consume within 3 days.
shippingDetails: Delivered in tin packs with syrup.

name: Milk Rasgulla
description: Rich rasgullas prepared with milk essence.
longDescription: A creamy variation of classic rasgulla with the richness of milk essence for a smoother taste.
expertTips: Enjoy with chilled rabri for a fusion dessert.

name: Classic Sandesh
description: Soft Bengali sweet made from chhena and sugar.
longDescription: Sandesh is a light and melt-in-mouth Bengali dessert, flavored with cardamom and saffron.
expertTips: Decorate with pistachio slivers for presentation.

name: Matka Sandesh
description: Sandesh served in traditional clay pots.
longDescription: A rustic twist to the classic sandesh, served in matkas for an earthy flavor and festive touch.
expertTips: Serve directly from matkas for authenticity.

name: Malpua Special
description: Traditional fried malpua soaked in syrup.
longDescription: A festive Indian pancake-style dessert, fried until golden and soaked in aromatic sugar syrup.
expertTips: Pair with thick rabri for a royal taste.
